title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:23 <lpereira> has quit  
01:42 <mflorea> has quit  
02:20 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
03:33 <DrLou> has quit  
07:00 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <Denis> has quit  
07:12 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: push\_release.sh currently does:  
07:12 <@sdumitriu> \* release versions on Jira  
07:12 <@sdumitriu> \* push artifacts to OW2 forge  
07:12 <@sdumitriu> \* create the release on ow2  
07:12 <@sdumitriu> \* update the download page on xwiki.org  
07:12 <@cjdelisle> haha nice  
07:13 <vmassol> nice  
07:13 <@sdumitriu> Working on posting the news on ow2  
07:13 <@sdumitriu> Almost done  
07:13 <vmassol> would be interesting to measure the new end to end release process time now  
07:14 <@cjdelisle> release notes and publicity are the only remaining hard part  
07:18 <vmassol> release notes could be "automated" by a process, i.e. for example an issue can only be closed if it's documented on xwiki.org and on the release notes page for the upcoming release  
07:18 <vmassol> (and we collectively enforce this by reopening issues if someone doesn't do it)  
07:19 <@sdumitriu> +1  
07:19 <vmassol> ok I'll send a vote email about this on the list  
07:44 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: seems there's still a build problem with the new initializer: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-tool-xmldoc-update-plugin/727/testReport/junit/com.xpn.xwiki.tool.doc/DocumentUpdateMojoTest/testXMLDocumentLoading/  
08:18 <vmassol> mflorea: seems it's the null check you removed but that must be a bug in the maven plugin  
08:18 <vmassol> :)  
08:18 <vmassol> the maven plugin isn't setting the EC  
08:18 <vmassol> (probably)  
08:19 <vmassol> ok found it, fixing  
08:19 <+mflorea> thanks  
08:25 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/ has been failing regularly  
08:25 <vmassol> ah jvm crash  
08:25 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/265/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg.framework/WysiwygTestSetup/WYSIWYG\_Selenium\_Tests/  
08:25 <vmassol> for the last run  
08:25 <+mflorea> I'll check after the platform is build and tests are re-run  
08:25 <vmassol> but the one before wasn't a crash: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/264/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/ImageTest/testInsertImageFromPageWithSpecialCharactersInName/  
08:26 <vmassol> "com.thoughtworks.selenium.SeleniumException: ERROR: Specified element is not a Select (has no options)"  
08:26 <vmassol> looks like http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/728/console is stuck  
08:28 <+mflorea> second time, xwiki-platform-watchlist builds fine locally  
08:28 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks for fixing my CLIRR error yesteday :)  
08:29 <+mflorea> np ;)  
08:29 <vmassol> (and sorry about that)  
08:29 <vmassol> (I was too lazy to run a build but that's bad I should have done it)  
08:29 <@sdumitriu> \* posting news on OW2  
08:29 <vmassol> I almost finished removing all calls to JCL  
08:29 <@sdumitriu> \* updating the API javadoc page  
08:30 <@sdumitriu> \* posting the news on xwiki.org  
08:30 <@sdumitriu> Trying to tackle Freshmeat  
08:30 <@sdumitriu> Then Twitter  
08:30 <vmassol> :)  
08:31 <@sdumitriu> I guess that we can live with having to manually update wikipedia and wikimatrix  
08:51 <+mflorea> guys, I don't understand why xwiki-platform is stuck. http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/728/consoleText . The last line seems to indicate that it has stuck while trying to update CI archive on maven.xwiki.org but I checked /home/maven/.hudson/jobs/xwiki-platform/modules/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-watchlist-ui/builds/2011-09-28\_07-56-20/archive/org.xwiki.platform/xwiki-platform-watchlist-ui/3.2-20110928.061303-374/xwiki-platform-watchlist-ui-3.2-2  
08:52 <+mflorea> there are no disk space problems on maven.xwiki.org  
08:52 <vmassol> so the file has been fully uploaded right?  
08:52 <+mflorea> yes  
08:52 <vmassol> I guess we only have 2 choices to find out the reason  
08:52 <+mflorea> I unzip it and it has all the file + the exact sizes from my local build  
08:52 <vmassol> 1) enable some debugging in jenkins, ie look at their source code  
08:53 <vmassol> 2) google to try to find someone who's had the same issue  
08:53 <+mflorea> I'll google a bit first  
08:56 <vmassol> mflorea: did you check jenkins logs (just in case)?  
08:56 <vmassol> I saw somewhere on google: /var/log/jenkins/jenkins.log  
08:57 <vmassol> actually logs are in .hudson I think  
08:59 <vmassol> https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Logging  
09:00 <vmassol> ere: http://ci.xwiki.org/log/all  
09:00 <vmassol> s/ere/here/  
09:01 <vmassol> some interesting stuff in there  
09:01 <vmassol> (not for this problem though)  
09:02 <vmassol> ah no maybe it is, the top is the most recent logs  
09:03 <vmassol> strang /home/maven/.hudson/fingerprints/31/94/77f2b376307aed300f6b50bd798d.xml isn't an xml file...  
09:05 <vmassol> anyway that's not the problem with the archive issue  
09:16 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:17 <vmassol> no more JCL calls in our code  
09:52 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <+sburjan> good morning :)  
10:20 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Do you remember the password for wikimatrix?  
10:20 <vmassol> ludovic changed it  
10:20 <vmassol> let me try to find it  
10:20 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I know  
10:20 <@sdumitriu> But I don't have it in this browser profile  
10:21 <vmassol> releasing over phone? :)  
10:23 <+sburjan> :)  
10:26 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: it's supposed to be the more recent first in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans unless that's changed  
10:27 <@sdumitriu> Right  
10:27 <+tmortagne> (easier to move then to archive after)  
10:32 <vmassol> sburjan: when can you start testing on FF7? (maybe you've already started!)  
10:32 <vmassol> (testing XE3.2M3 that is)  
10:32 <+sburjan> haven't started  
10:33 <+sburjan> only installed FF7 at home. and it really uses \_much\_ less RAM :D  
10:33 <+sburjan> starting to test now  
10:33 <vmassol> with FF7?  
10:33 <+sburjan> yepp, this is the major improvement of FF7  
10:33 <vmassol> I mean you're starting to test XE3.2M3 with FF7 now?  
10:33 <+sburjan> starting now, yes  
10:34 <+sburjan> installing a FF7 on a VM on out test machine  
10:34 <vmassol> ok great  
10:34 <+sburjan> \*ouyr  
10:34 <+sburjan> I don't think we'll have any new issue, but it's best to be vigilent  
10:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> yes  
10:36 <vmassol> I'm in a conf call right now btw, till 12:30GMT+1  
10:37 <+sburjan> I know. enjoy :)  
10:37 <evalica> has quit  
11:06 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:31 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <vmassol> fyi: will try to release XE3.2M3 commons/rendering on Maven Central today  
11:38 <+sburjan> btw, what means to release on Maven Central ? means that Maven hosts our artefacats ?  
11:40 <vmassol> it means they'll be on Maven Central repository  
11:40 <vmassol> (this repo is by default configured in all maven installs)  
11:41 <+sburjan> I guess they host a lot of Open Source artefacts  
11:41 <vmassol> mflorea: should we kill the stuck platform build?  
11:41 <vmassol> (I think we hsould)  
11:41 <+sburjan> and what was their requirement in order to host our packages ?  
11:41 <+sburjan> this is the part I'm curious of  
11:42 <vmassol> https://docs.sonatype.org/display/Repository/Central+Sync+Requirements  
11:42 <+mflorea> vmassol: the problem is not the jenkins archiving phase but the same null EC  
11:42 <+mflorea> on platform-search-lucene  
11:42 <+mflorea> it hangs when running tests  
11:42 <vmassol> mflorea: this http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/730/console ?  
11:42 <+mflorea> I can reproduce it locally  
11:43 <vmassol> interesting  
11:43 <+mflorea> yes, but actually http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/730/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-search-lucene/console  
11:43 <vmassol> so the issue is the multirhead -T2?  
11:43 <vmassol> I ean  
11:43 <vmassol> I mean  
11:43 <vmassol> this is why we don't see it in the good order int he console?  
11:44 <+mflorea> if you look at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/730/ you can see that lucene is "1 hr 28 min and counting"  
11:44 <vmassol> checking lucene thread boostrapping code  
11:45 <vmassol> fixing  
11:45 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:46 <+mflorea> re multithreaded, yes that makes the console output hard to read, but on the other hand http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/730/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-search-lucene/console doesn't show the problem either.. I had to built it locally to see it.  
11:48 <vmassol> mflorea: fixed but  I think we have to review all other places. I'll have a look now  
11:49 <+mflorea> ok  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea: should all be fixed now  
12:00 <vmassol> we'll need to improve that in the future somehow so that we use the same code in one place only to reduce errors  
12:00 <vmassol> I'll stop the stuck build  
12:01 <vmassol> stoppped  
12:05 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <vmassol> grr still hanging http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/731/console  
12:13 <vmassol> stopping since thee are changes I did not included  
12:18 <mflorea> has quit  
12:24 <vmassol> still hanging, trying to reproduce locally  
12:27 <+sburjan> ok, reported two bugs  
12:27 <+sburjan> starting to pack my stuff  
12:29 <vmassol> you're leaving somewhere?  
12:31 <+sburjan> yes, changing HQ :)  
12:33 <+sburjan> moving to new office building  
12:34 <vmassol> ah right  
12:34 <vmassol> nice  
12:34 <vmassol> so you won't have internet connection immeditely  
12:35 <vmassol> make sure you can report to us any issue with 3.2M3 quickly  
12:35 <vmassol> since we only have less than 1 week to fix them  
12:35 <vmassol> for RC1  
12:36 <+sburjan> nope, only Monday or Tuesday  
12:36 <+sburjan> so I think that for sure tomorrow and tomorrow morning I'll be online from home  
12:36 <+sburjan> it's easy to test at home, FF7 is already installed :)  
12:43 <vmassol> k  
13:25 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:49 <sburjan> has quit  
14:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're editing the page too?  
14:34 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not anymore  
14:34 <vmassol> k  
14:35 <+tmortagne> was looking at the source, looks like there is an escaping bug  
14:35 <vmassol> the ##{{{ }}}## ?  
14:35 <+tmortagne> {{{{{include}}}}} rendered as  {\{include}\}  
14:35 <vmassol> ?  
14:35 <vmassol> it's fine  
14:35 <vmassol> except for the style  
14:36 <+tmortagne> should be {{include}}  
14:36 <vmassol> but that's a known issue  
14:36 <vmassol> it is  
14:36 <+tmortagne> why \ ?  
14:36 <vmassol> for me it is  
14:36 <vmassol> there's no \  
14:36 <vmassol> I think you looked when I was fixing it  
14:36 <vmassol> :)  
14:36 <vmassol> so the view and the content wasn't matching when you checked  
14:36 <+tmortagne> ok that's why I did not understood then  
14:37 <+tmortagne> I see \ and when looking at the source the syntax seemed right  
14:37 <vmassol> :)  
14:38 <vmassol> hmm I see that clicking on inline form on home page generates:  
14:38 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/inline/Main/WebHome?&editor=inline  
14:38 <vmassol> shouldn't we use the view action instead now?  
14:38 <+tmortagne> you should use ~ instead of {{{ btw  
14:38 <+tmortagne> you would not have style issue  
14:38 <+tmortagne> {{{ should be used only when you can't use ~ IMO  
14:38 <vmassol> yes but that's a workarouind  
14:38 <vmassol> IMO {{{ is much better than escapes  
14:39 <vmassol> easier to use  
14:39 <+tmortagne> putting 6 chat instead of one is easier ?  
14:39 <vmassol> yes  
14:39 <+tmortagne> and it's easier to read with ~, you see right away that it's escaped syntax  
14:39 <vmassol> I know that whatever I put inside is ok  
14:39 <vmassol> I don't have to compute in my head all chars I need to escape  
14:39 <vmassol> anyway  
14:39 <vmassol> it's up to the user  
14:40 <vmassol> both need to work  
14:40 <vmassol> hmm I thought this was working now: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome?editor=inline  
14:40 <+tmortagne> sure but since you complain about the style you could easily fix it ;)  
14:40 <vmassol> yep  
14:42 <vmassol> I probably misunderstood something  
14:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know anything about it?  
14:44 <+tmortagne> actually I tough editor=inline was already there before mflorea latest changes  
14:45 <+tmortagne> but don't know very well what as been done for this particular subject  
14:47 <+tmortagne> vmassol: see http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiAllGroup?editor=inline  
14:47 <vmassol> ah edit, stupid me  
14:47 <vmassol> I mixed up view and edit  
14:47 <+tmortagne> hmm does not seems to be the same thing actually in 3.1  
14:48 <vmassol> hmm not working for the main webhome though  
14:48 <+tmortagne> it does not really display inline mode as it should  
14:48 <vmassol> (I'm on master)  
14:48 <+tmortagne> but myxwiki is beta so...  
14:48 <+tmortagne> try on a page that really is supposed to be editable as inline maybe  
14:48 <+tmortagne> like a group  
14:49 <vmassol> well the home page is supposed to be  
14:49 <vmassol> it's the dashboard  
14:49 <+tmortagne> right  
14:49 <+tmortagne> maybe some pages need to be updated to not check the action anymore but the editor instead  
14:50 <+tmortagne> probably missing some retro-compatibility stuff  
14:50 <+tmortagne> but it's not that easy since it's not correct to put inline as action if the action is actually edit  
14:51 <vmassol> well we're suposed to be 100% backward compat  
14:51 <+tmortagne> probably what happen on  http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiAllGroup?editor=inline  
14:51 <vmassol> we need to fix this before the RC1  
14:51 <vmassol> a pity marius isn't here  
14:52 <+tmortagne> not sure how to "fix" it, the only way would be to force inline as context action which is not correct, all we can do is fixing the standard pages I think  
14:52 <vmassol> has marius mentioned he wasn't going to be present today?  
14:52 <+tmortagne> no idea  
17:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok to put enforcer rule for JCL and Log4J in top level POM?  
17:18 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep  
17:18 <vmassol> ok doing it  
17:19 <vmassol> actually it's vicious because some modules in platform core were using JCL  
17:19 <vmassol> but they didn't decalre a dep on it, it was provided transitively  
17:19 <vmassol> right now I'm a bit afraid to perform the enforcer check transitively  
17:20 <+tmortagne> enforcer can only look at pom.xml ? I tough it was possible to check java imports  
17:20 <vmassol> we need a custom check that verifies that no code uses code from a non declared dep  
17:20 <vmassol> there's a maven plugin for that actually, I don't know if it can fail the build, I'll check  
17:22 <vmassol> t's the dependncy plugin, the problem is probbaly the false negatives: http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-dependency-plugin/examples/failing-the-build-on-dependency-analysis-warnings.html  
17:22 <vmassol> I think I sent a mail about this not too long ago  
17:30 <vmassol> I could use the enforcer plugin to check transitively but we'll probably need a lot of excludes in this case...  
17:30 <vmassol> I'll explore a bit the options  
18:41 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
18:42 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hi, will you have some time to upgrade myxwiki.org to 3.2M3 today?  
18:42 <@cjdelisle> Not today unfortunately, have company coming over.  
18:43 <vmassol> it would be real good to upgrade it to verify 2.3M3 works in a real life conditions so that we can fix stuff in RC1  
18:43 <vmassol> ok  
18:43 <vmassol> any volunteer?  
18:43 <vmassol> (I would do it but I'd like to work on pushing our artifacts to maven central now)  
18:43 <@cjdelisle> I might be able to do it tonight, if not tonight then tomorrow.  
18:56 <vmassol> guys is it normal that if I do a: git checkout xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3  
18:56 <vmassol> when I look at the pom.xml I see 3.2-SNAPSHOT and not 3.2-milestone-3  
18:56 <vmassol> ?  
18:57 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
18:57 <vmassol> for miletone-2 it seems ok  
18:57 <+tmortagne> indeed the tag is wrong  
18:58 <vmassol> sdumitriu: what happened?  
18:58 <+tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3/pom.xml  
18:58 <@sdumitriu> No idea  
18:58 <+tmortagne> missing a push ?  
18:58 <@sdumitriu> The others seem correct  
18:58 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I wanted to build and deploy to sonatype's repo to stage for central but I need to be able to build 3.2M3  
18:59 <vmassol> yes the others look correct  
19:00 <@sdumitriu> The artifacts seem to be OK  
19:00 <@sdumitriu> So maybe just the tag was wrong  
19:00 <@sdumitriu> I'll recreate the tag and push it  
19:01 <vmassol> unfortunately it's complex to push existing artifacts to central  
19:01 <vmassol> I haven't found a way to do that  
19:01 <vmassol> (except 1 by 1 but that's too painful)  
19:02 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you can't use deploy:deploy-file in a script ?  
19:03 <vmassol> yes that's possible but it needs to be done for all files and for all artifacts  
19:03 <vmassol> for each artifact that's 8 files  
19:04 <+tmortagne> sure but you can find all those in a bash script using find or something and execute deploy:deploy-file for each  
19:04 <vmassol> how can I find them all?  
19:04 <vmassol> based on groupId and version?  
19:04 <vmassol> from my local repo?  
19:04 <vmassol> what if I don't have them all in my local repo?  
19:05 <@sdumitriu> Updated the tag  
19:05 <+tmortagne> if yo don't have them of course will be hard to send them but that's always true :)  
19:05 <vmassol> nope  
19:05 <+tmortagne> you could execute the script from maven.xwiki.org  
19:05 <vmassol> when I build from a tag I know I have them all  
19:05 <+tmortagne> you would have better upload speed  anyway  
19:05 <vmassol> that's the only way to be sure  
19:05 <vmassol> maven.xwiki.org indee  
19:05 <vmassol> better  
19:06 <vmassol> I could try  
19:06 <+tmortagne> well if you get all the xwiki-commons\*3.2-milestone-3 you should be sure you have all of them too  
19:06 <vmassol> would need my creds on there  
19:06 <+tmortagne> xwiki-commons\*3.2-milestone-3.\*  
19:06 <vmassol> ok I'll try since I really think it's better to push already released artifacts  
19:07 <vmassol> going to take me a lot more time than I had planned though ;)  
19:07 <+tmortagne> when you get something nice could be added to release process  
19:10 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:13 <vmassol> seems maven is not installed on maven.xwiki.org  
19:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu: would be good to organize better the maven user home directory on maven.xwiki.org  
19:14 <vmassol> there are lots of shell scripts lying around  
19:15 <vmassol> even a groovy one  
19:15 <vmassol> some jar like javax.jms.jar  
19:17 <@sdumitriu> Removed the groovy one  
19:20 <@sdumitriu> I'd remove the ssh-agent\*.sh ones since I made aliases  
19:25 <vmassol> I think a directory hold them all would be good, wdyt?

21:05 <vmassol> tying to repair the index
